description.narrative: Established in 2015, Fido Solutions Limited (Fido or the Company), is the leading consumer fintech operating in Ghana. Since 2019, Fido has funded more than $86 million in principle via 1.3m loans to over 330k customers. Over 22% of the companys borrowers are MSMEs that use the loan proceeds for working capital purposes. The remaining 78% are individual consumers. The Company intends to expand to six new markets by 2025, as well as to release innovative products that will promote financial inclusiveness.

The project is expected to improve access to quality consumer finance. While access to transaction accounts and electronic payments have rapidly increased in recent years, access to credit remains limited. Uganda and Ghana see similar constraints in access to consumer and microenterprise credit: both markets are characterized by high transaction costs, limited credit bureau coverage, and lack of collateral which limits access to credit for larger businesses and more affluent households. Beyond the Company, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase competitiveness. Credit markets in target countries is led by commercial banks with limited penetration of credit card offering and a prevalence of term financing products with limited flexibility and high collateral requirements. While a small number of digital lenders have emerged in Ghana and to a lesser extent in Uganda, other markets have virtually no digital credit offering. Fido will demonstrate the viability of leveraging a strong technology platform and telco independent business model to scale and diversify products
